body_html:
Is it possible that this just works now? As far as I can tell...

emb = tf.reshape(..., [maxLength, batchSize, embDimSize])

...with maxLength and batchSize as tf.Tensor objects, and embDimSize as a Python int should trigger auto-packing, and the packed new-shape argument should make it back out of tensor_util.constant_value_as_shape() (added in 706a5ba on June 25th).
body_text:
Is it possible that this just works now? As far as I can tell...
emb = tf.reshape(..., [maxLength, batchSize, embDimSize])
...with maxLength and batchSize as tf.Tensor objects, and embDimSize as a Python int should trigger auto-packing, and the packed new-shape argument should make it back out of tensor_util.constant_value_as_shape() (added in 706a5ba on June 25th).
body:
Is it possible that this just works now? As far as I can tell...

``` python
emb = tf.reshape(..., [maxLength, batchSize, embDimSize])
```

...with `maxLength` and `batchSize` as `tf.Tensor` objects, and `embDimSize` as a Python `int` should trigger auto-packing, and the packed new-shape argument should make it back out of `tensor_util.constant_value_as_shape()` (added in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/706a5baa6e633ffbbcdf49f69e3ef88421001a76 on June 25th).
